decks.notes: The main concept of this Esper Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. Utilizing a combination of efficient threats like Sunpearl Kirin and Hopeless Nightmare, alongside control elements like Go for the Throat and Nowhere to Run, the deck aims to quickly build up a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy. By maintaining pressure and disrupting their plays, the deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the battlefield. By utilizing a combination of efficient creatures like Nurturing Pixie and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, along with removal spells like Go for the Throat, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain the upper hand throughout the game. Cards like Nowhere to Run and Hopeless Nightmare help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while pushing for a quick victory. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game and win through aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that disrupt the opponent's strategy and board state. It includes removal spells like Ride's End and Temporary Lockdown, as well as board wipes such as Day of Judgment. The deck also features powerful cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Mazemind Tome to generate card advantage and maintain control. The win condition comes from overwhelming the opponent with resilient threats like Overlord of the Mistmoors and Beza, the Bounding Spring. This deck aims to win by outlasting the opponent and dominating the late game.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Mosswood Dreadknight, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Maelstrom Pulse. The deck also includes cards that provide additional value, such as Heritage Reclamation and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber. By applying pressure early on and maintaining control of the board, this Golgari Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this Abzan Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By playing efficient threats like Skirmish Rhino and Sunpearl Kirin, along with removal spells like Maelstrom Pulse and Nowhere to Run, the deck aims to quickly apply pressure to the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Cards like Loran of the Third Path and Severance Priest provide additional value and support to the aggressive strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.
